items.description: River Foulness and Market Weighton catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Foulness, Market Weighton Canal, North Cave Beck, Ellerker Beck, Mill Beck

items.message: The Flood Alert for the River Foulness and Market Weighton remains in force due to recent rainfall causing river levels to rise. The area of particular concern is around South Cave, and flooding of low lying roads, farmlands and paths in this area may still be possible. We are monitoring the situation closely, and will update this message by 5 PM on Friday 21/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: River Leen, Day Brook and Tottle Brook in Nottinghamshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Leen, Day Brook, Tottle Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Trent, River Greet, Potwell Dyke, Carr Dyke, Dover Beck, Cocker Beck, Thurgarton Beck, Fairham Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
The next high tide is expected to be higher than normal and may result in us issuing a further alert for the East Coast of Dorset at Preston Beach.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
